summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, conducted in Pensacola, Florida on February 19, 2020. The interviewee, a driver/house manager, provides details about his employment, the presence of young girls at Epstein's Palm Beach home, the roles of Ghislaine Maxwell, and observations of Epstein's social circle and behavior.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure, described as the interviewee's former employer. The interviewee states Epstein was 'a dangerous man' and expresses relief at his death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as being involved with Epstein, giving orders to staff, and being present with young girls. The interviewee states her arrival changed the environment negatively.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a guest who visited Epstein's home and traveled with him from the airport.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Listed among the many different people seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Robert Kennedy
persons.context: Listed among the many different people seen at Epstein's home.

persons.name: Andersson
persons.context: Mentioned as having a friendship with Maxwell, though the nature of their relationship was unclear.

connections.description: Worked closely together; Maxwell gave orders to staff on Epstein's behalf and was frequently with him and young girls.
Described as having a friendship, though the interviewee was unsure if they were close or hated each other.
Prince Andrew was a guest at Epstein's home and traveled with him from the airport.
Maxwell gave orders to staff (like the interviewee) for Epstein, such as instructing him to pick people up.

events.title: FBI Interview of Former Epstein Employee
events.description: An FBI interview is conducted with a former driver/house manager for Jeffrey Epstein in Pensacola, Florida.

events.title: Epstein's Death Noted
events.description: The interviewee expresses relief that Jeffrey Epstein had died, calling him 'a dangerous man'.

events.title: Regular Movie Outings
events.description: Epstein, Maxwell, and others went to movies approximately three times a week at theaters in Boca Raton and West Palm Beach, often around 9pm/10pm.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrival Changes Environment
events.description: The interviewee states that when Ghislaine Maxwell arrived, 'everything went to hell' and the environment at Epstein's home changed negatively.

locations: Palm Beach, Florida (location of Epstein's home)
Bear Lakes (neighborhood where a girl lived)
Boca Raton, Florida (location of a high-class movie theater)
West Palm Beach, Florida (location of another frequented theater)
keyFacts: A former Epstein employee (driver/house manager) was interviewed by the FBI and stated that before he and his wife left Epstein's employment, 'they only saw two young girls' at the Palm Beach home.

The interviewee described a specific young girl who came with her mother, a massage therapist known to law enforcement. The mother allegedly told Epstein, 'Whatever you want to do with [her] she can come anytime.'
Ghislaine Maxwell is described as giving most of the orders to staff, including instructing the driver to pick up girls. The interviewee said when Maxwell arrived, 'everything went to hell.'
The interviewee witnessed Epstein 'kissing girls on the cheek and patting them on the buttocks' and saw an English girl come into the kitchen topless.
The interviewee expressed relief that Epstein was dead, calling him 'a dangerous man.'
